Label: DE-1 PWI: Ephemeris and Attitude Parameters - Donald Gurnett (University Iowa)

DatasetLink.Title: University of Iowa DE-1 PWI Page
DatasetLink.Text: More information on the DE-1 Plama Wave Investigation is available at the University of Iowa DE-1 PWI Page

VariableDescription.Name: B_Magnitude
VariableDescription.Header:
#              ************************************
#              *****    GLOBAL ATTRIBUTES    ******
#              ************************************
#
#     PROJECT                         DE>Dynamics Explorer
#     SOURCE_NAME                     DE1>Dynamics Explorer 1
#     DISCIPLINE                      Space Physics>Magnetospheric Science
#     DATA_TYPE                       OR-AT>Orbit-Attitude
#     DESCRIPTOR                      PWI>
#     TIME_RESOLUTION                 8 Seconds
#     DATA_VERSION                    1
#     SKELETON_VERSION                1
#     PI_NAME                         Donald Gurnett
#     PI_AFFILIATION                  University Iowa
#     TEXT                            S. D. Shawhan, D. A. Gurnett, D. L. Odem, R. A. Helliwell, and C. G. Park, The                         
#     TEXT                             plasma wave and quasi-static electric field instrument (PWI) for Dynamics Explorer-A,                 
#                                      Space Sci. Instrumen., 5, 535, 1981.                                                                  
#     HTTP_LINK                       http://www-pw.physics.uiowa.edu/de/home.html
#     LINK_TEXT                       More information on the DE-1 Plama Wave Investigation is available at the University                   
#                                      of Iowa DE-1 PWI Page                                                                                 
#     LINK_TITLE                      University of Iowa DE-1 PWI Page
#     TEXT_SUPPLEMENT                 Two Dynamics Explorer (DE) spacecraft were launched August 3, 1981, and placed                         
#     TEXT_SUPPLEMENT                  into coplanar polar orbits with DE-1 in a highly elliptical orbit and DE-2                            
#     TEXT_SUPPLEMENT                  in a lower more circular orbit. The primary objective of the DE program was                           
#                                      to investigate magnetosphere-ionosphere-atmosphere coupling processes.                                
#                                     The DE mission provided a wealth of new information on a wide variety of magnetospheric                
#                                      plasma wave phenomena including auroral kilometric radiation, auroral hiss,                           
#                                      Z mode radiation, narrow-band electromagnetic emissions associated with equatorial                    
#                                      upper hybrid waves, whistler mode emissions, wave-particle interactions stimulated                    
#                                      by ground VLF transmitters, equatorial ion cyclotron emissions, ion Bernstein                         
#                                      mode emissions, and electric field turbulence along the auroral field lines.                          
#                                     This file contains 8 second resolution emphemeris and spacecraft attitude parameters                   
#                                      that coincide with DE-1 telemetry frames containing PWI lowrate data.  These                          
#                                      parameters are not to be taken as an authoritative set, but are convenient                            
#                                      when working with PWI science data products.  Most of these data are provided                         
#                                      in the Geocentric Equatorial Inertial (GEI) TOD reference frame.  The Z axis                          
#                                      of the GEI frame is parallel to Earth's spin axis; the X axis points towards                          
#                                      the First Point of Aries with the Y axis aligned so as to generate a right-handed                     
#                                      coordinate system.                                                                                    
#                                     For a detailed description of the Plasma Wave Instrument, the reader is referred                       
#                                      to the Space Science Instrumentation referenece above.                                                
#     INSTRUMENT_TYPE                 Radio and Plasma Waves (space)
#     MISSION_GROUP                   DE
#     LOGICAL_SOURCE_DESCRIPTION      DE-1 PWI: Ephemeris and Attitude Parameters
#     LOGICAL_SOURCE                  DE_PWI_OR-AT
#     LOGICAL_FILE_ID                 de1_pwi_or-at_19810916
#     GENERATED_BY                    chris-piker@uiowa.edu
#                                     larry-granroth@uiowa.edu
#                                     pickett@uiowa.edu
#     ACKNOWLEDGEMENT                 Users of the DE-1 PWI data are encouraged to acknowledge NASA CDAWeb and The                           
#                                      University of Iow as the source of the data in any publication.                                       
#     RULES_OF_USE                    DE-1 PWI ephemeris and attitude data are open to everyone.  However, users of                          
#     RULES_OF_USE                     these data are encouraged to contact the PI institute and the DE-1 PWI website                        
#                                      should questions arise.                                                                               
#
#              ************************************
#              ****  RECORD VARYING VARIABLES  ****
#              ************************************
#
#  1. NSSDC standard reference time
#       NOTES:  NSSDC standard reference time associated with the start of a PWI SFR sweep.
#  2. Magnetic field strength
#       NOTES:  The measured magnetic field strength.  Any descrepency between these data and those provided by the magnetometer instrument's own files should be resolved in favor of the latter.  See 'Magnetic Field Observations on DE-A and -B', W. H. Farthing, et al., Space Science Instrumentation 5 (1981) for more information
#
#  
# Key Parameter and Survey data (labels K0,K1,K2) are preliminary browse data.
# Generated by CDAWeb on: Thu Jan 15 22:27:34 2015
VariableDescription.VariableInfo:
#       NOTES:  The measured magnetic field strength.  Any descrepency between these data and those provided by the magnetometer instrument's own files should be resolved in favor of the latter.  See 'Magnetic Field Observations on DE-A and -B', W. H. Farthing, et al., Space Science Instrumentation 5 (1981) for more information
#
SCET                                B_MAG
dd-mm-yyyy hh:mm:ss.mil.mic            nT
16-09-1981 05:20:12.853.000       610.000

VariableDescription.Name: GEI_B_vec
VariableDescription.LongDescription: GEI magnetic field vector, B(x), B(y), B(z)
VariableDescription.Header:
#              ************************************
#              *****    GLOBAL ATTRIBUTES    ******
#              ************************************
#
#     PROJECT                         DE>Dynamics Explorer
#     SOURCE_NAME                     DE1>Dynamics Explorer 1
#     DISCIPLINE                      Space Physics>Magnetospheric Science
#     DATA_TYPE                       OR-AT>Orbit-Attitude
#     DESCRIPTOR                      PWI>
#     TIME_RESOLUTION                 8 Seconds

#     SKELETON_VERSION                1
#     PI_NAME                         Donald Gurnett
#     PI_AFFILIATION                  University Iowa
#     TEXT                            S. D. Shawhan, D. A. Gurnett, D. L. Odem, R. A. Helliwell, and C. G. Park, The                         
#     TEXT                             plasma wave and quasi-static electric field instrument (PWI) for Dynamics Explorer-A,                 
#                                      Space Sci. Instrumen., 5, 535, 1981.                                                                  
#     HTTP_LINK                       http://www-pw.physics.uiowa.edu/de/home.html
#     LINK_TEXT                       More information on the DE-1 Plama Wave Investigation is available at the University                   
#                                      of Iowa DE-1 PWI Page                                                                                 
#     LINK_TITLE                      University of Iowa DE-1 PWI Page
#     TEXT_SUPPLEMENT                 Two Dynamics Explorer (DE) spacecraft were launched August 3, 1981, and placed                         
#     TEXT_SUPPLEMENT                  into coplanar polar orbits with DE-1 in a highly elliptical orbit and DE-2                            
#     TEXT_SUPPLEMENT                  in a lower more circular orbit. The primary objective of the DE program was                           
#                                      to investigate magnetosphere-ionosphere-atmosphere coupling processes.                                
#                                     The DE mission provided a wealth of new information on a wide variety of magnetospheric                
#                                      plasma wave phenomena including auroral kilometric radiation, auroral hiss,                           
#                                      Z mode radiation, narrow-band electromagnetic emissions associated with equatorial                    
#                                      upper hybrid waves, whistler mode emissions, wave-particle interactions stimulated                    
#                                      by ground VLF transmitters, equatorial ion cyclotron emissions, ion Bernstein                         
#                                      mode emissions, and electric field turbulence along the auroral field lines.                          
#                                     This file contains 8 second resolution emphemeris and spacecraft attitude parameters                   
#                                      that coincide with DE-1 telemetry frames containing PWI lowrate data.  These                          
#                                      parameters are not to be taken as an authoritative set, but are convenient                            
#                                      when working with PWI science data products.  Most of these data are provided                         
#                                      in the Geocentric Equatorial Inertial (GEI) TOD reference frame.  The Z axis                          
#                                      of the GEI frame is parallel to Earth's spin axis; the X axis points towards                          
#                                      the First Point of Aries with the Y axis aligned so as to generate a right-handed                     
#                                      coordinate system.                                                                                    
#                                     For a detailed description of the Plasma Wave Instrument, the reader is referred                       
#                                      to the Space Science Instrumentation referenece above.                                                
#     INSTRUMENT_TYPE                 Radio and Plasma Waves (space)
#     MISSION_GROUP                   DE
#     LOGICAL_SOURCE_DESCRIPTION      DE-1 PWI: Ephemeris and Attitude Parameters
#     LOGICAL_SOURCE                  DE_PWI_OR-AT
#     LOGICAL_FILE_ID                 de1_pwi_or-at_19810916
#     GENERATED_BY                    chris-piker@uiowa.edu
#                                     larry-granroth@uiowa.edu
#                                     pickett@uiowa.edu
#     ACKNOWLEDGEMENT                 Users of the DE-1 PWI data are encouraged to acknowledge NASA CDAWeb and The                           
#                                      University of Iow as the source of the data in any publication.                                       
#     RULES_OF_USE                    DE-1 PWI ephemeris and attitude data are open to everyone.  However, users of                          
#     RULES_OF_USE                     these data are encouraged to contact the PI institute and the DE-1 PWI website                        
#                                      should questions arise.                                                                               
#
#              ************************************
#              ****  RECORD VARYING VARIABLES  ****
#              ************************************
#
#  1. NSSDC standard reference time
#       NOTES:  NSSDC standard reference time associated with the start of a PWI SFR sweep.
#  2. GEI magnetic field vector, B(x), B(y), B(z)
#       NOTES:  GEI (Geocentric Equatorial Inertial) Magnetic Vector in nanoTesla.  The order of the vector components is B(x), B(y), B(z).  Any descrepency between these data and those provided by the magnetometer instrument's own files should be resolved in favor of the latter.  See 'Magnetic Field Observations on DE-A and -B', W. H. Farthing, et al., Space Science Instrumentation 5 (1981) for more information
#
#  
# Key Parameter and Survey data (labels K0,K1,K2) are preliminary browse data.
# Generated by CDAWeb on: Thu Jan 15 22:27:34 2015
VariableDescription.VariableInfo:
#       NOTES:  GEI (Geocentric Equatorial Inertial) Magnetic Vector in nanoTesla.  The order of the vector components is B(x), B(y), B(z).  Any descrepency between these data and those provided by the magnetometer instrument's own files should be resolved in favor of the latter.  See 'Magnetic Field Observations on DE-A and -B', W. H. Farthing, et al., Space Science Instrumentation 5 (1981) for more information
#
SCET                                             BX_GEI                      BY_GEI                      BZ_GEI
dd-mm-yyyy hh:mm:ss.mil.mic                          nT                          nT                          nT
16-09-1981 05:20:12.853.000                     180.000                    -50.0000                    -580.000
